go_data.justification: HIF2A is involved in regulating genes under hypoxia, implying a role in transcription activation.
HIF2A plays a central role in regulating adaptive responses to hypoxia.
HIF2A is crucial in mediating cellular responses to hypoxia, including erythropoiesis and angiogenesis.
As a transcription factor, HIF2A would be expected to localize to the nucleus to regulate gene expression.
